intro: Trichocentrum triquetrum, commonly known as the three-cornered orchid, is a species of epiphytic orchid native to Central and South America. It features a sympodial growth habit, with pseudobulbs that are often triangular in cross-section, giving it its common name. The plant produces pendulous inflorescences with showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink.
